author: imman6820
content: I think the point was that telling your neighbor their gate is open is alerting the public to not trust their stuff in your neighbors house. ü§∑

author: mrabino1
content: for me it is a calculation of future miner rewards that should be brought forward and discounted to an NPV of the Merge.... and then the rewards leading up to the at merge should be elevated (probably the month before, the week of, and emphasis on the day of the merge)  to adjust for X months of future mining activity  ... i will try to get some cycles on a spreadsheet to share to get thoughts.    where possible i personally think this is much easier to implement and have the same economic incentives in play as opposed to paying miners via smart contract after the merge which is pure dead weight loss economic activity ...

author: m.kalinin
content: Changing cryptoeconomics status quo may not be that easy to get released. Implementation-wise it might be, but analysis of impacts and governance around it may be difficult.

author: mrabino1
content: for sure... that said always better discuss impacts when reviewing and referencing a model as opposed to a purely theoretical construct

author: hsiaowei
content:
((I guess this is the most related channel))
About the first star name of the protocol release code, POAP community helped to create a poap.vote poll on the A-star name: https://poap.vote/poll/46 üó≥Ô∏è

The candidates - Altair, Arcturus, and Antares - are based on Edson's proposal. Some basic intro here: https://notes.ethereum.org/@hww/stars-of-A üåû

Voting ends in 2 days 11 hours. If you have questions, please go visit EthStaker discord #poap channel (https://discord.gg/6wrNCC9Z).
